com.innowhere.jnieasy.core.mem
Interface NativeBufferIterator

public interface NativeBufferIterator

The interface NativeBufferIterator is implemented by the framework to provide a native buffer iterator.

A native buffer iterator allows to read/write the native memory sequentially; an internal counter working as the relative offset of the buffer address is incremented automatically depending on the data read/written.

Author:
jmarranz
See Also:
NativeBuffer.newBufferIterator()

Method Detail

getBuffer

NativeBuffer getBuffer()
Returns the parent native buffer.

Returns:
the parent buffer.

currentOffset

long currentOffset()
Returns the current relative position of the iterator in bytes working as an offset.

Absolute position address of the iterator must be calculated as: buffer address + iterator position

Returns:
the current position.

currentAddress

long currentAddress()
Returns the current absolute address position of the iterator.

Absolute address is calculated as: buffer address + current offset

Returns:
the current absolute address position.
See Also:
NativeAddress.getValue()

forward

long forward(long bytes)
Increments the current relative position with the specified number of bytes.

Parameters:
bytes - the number of bytes to increment.
Returns:
the current relative position after increment.

backward

long backward(long bytes)
Decrements the current relative position with the specified number of bytes.

Parameters:
bytes - the number of bytes to decrement.
Returns:
the current relative position after increment.

nextBoolean

boolean nextBoolean()
Returns a boolean read from the native memory in the parent buffer address + the current relative position.

The iterator is moved forward 1 byte (Java boolean size).

Returns:
the data read from native memory.
See Also:
NativeBuffer.getBoolean(long)

setBoolean

void setBoolean(boolean value)
Updates with a boolean data the native memory in the buffer address + the current relative position.

The iterator is moved forward 1 byte (Java boolean size).

Parameters:
value - the new value to write.

nextAddress

long nextAddress()
Returns a platform address value read from the native memory in the parent buffer address + the current relative position.

In a 32 bit platform an int value is read, in a 64 bit will be a long value read.

The iterator is moved forward 4 bytes in 32 bit and 8 bytes if 64 bit.

Returns:
the data read from native memory.
See Also:
NativeBuffer.getAddress(long)

setAddress

void setAddress(long value)
Updates with a platform address data the native memory in the buffer address + the current relative position.

In a 32 bit platform an int value is written, in a 64 bit will be a long value written.

The iterator is moved forward 4 bytes in 32 bit and 8 bytes if 64 bit.

Parameters:
value - the new value to write.
See Also:
NativeBuffer.setAddress(long,long)

getAnsiString

java.lang.String getAnsiString()
Returns a java.lang.String read from the native memory in the buffer address + the current relative position until a '\0' character is found, converting each byte (C char) read to a Java char.

The '\0' finalizer is not assigned to the String.

The iterator is moved forward the string length + 1 (the '\0' character) bytes.

Returns:
the ANSI String read from native memory.
See Also:
NativeBuffer.getAnsiString(long)

setAnsiString

void setAnsiString(java.lang.String value)
Writes on the native memory the specified java.lang.String in the buffer address + the current relative position, each character is converted to one byte (C char), the '\0' character is written in the end.

The iterator is moved forward the string length + 1 (the '\0' character) bytes.

Parameters:
value - the new ANSI string to write.
See Also:
NativeBuffer.setAnsiString(long,String)

getUnicodeString

java.lang.String getUnicodeString()
Returns a java.lang.String read from the native memory in the buffer address + the current relative position until a C L'\0' character is found converting each 2 byte (Win32 wchar_t) or 4 byte (Linux/Mac/Solaris wchar_t) read to a Java char.

The '\0' finalizer is not assigned to the String.

The iterator is moved forward the string length * sizeof(wchar_t) + sizeof(wchar_t) (the final L'\0' character) bytes.

Returns:
the UNICODE String read from native memory.
See Also:
NativeBuffer.getUnicodeString(long)

setUnicodeString

void setUnicodeString(java.lang.String value)
Writes on the native memory the specified java.lang.String in the buffer address + the current relative position, each character is converted to 2 bytes (Win32 wchar_t) or 4 bytes (Linux/Mac/Solaris wchar_t), the L'\0' character is written in the end.

The iterator is moved forward the string length * sizeof(wchar_t) + sizeof(wchar_t) (the C L'\0' character) bytes.

Parameters:
value - the new UNICODE string to write.
See Also:
NativeBuffer.setUnicodeString(long,String)

getAnsiStringBuffer

java.lang.StringBuffer getAnsiStringBuffer()
Returns a java.lang.StringBuffer read from the native memory in the buffer address + the current relative position until a '\0' character is found, converting each byte (C char) read to a Java char.

Current implementation calls getAnsiString() and copies it to a new StringBuffer.

Returns:
the ANSI StringBuffer read from native memory.
See Also:
NativeBuffer.getAnsiStringBuffer(long)

setAnsiStringBuffer

void setAnsiStringBuffer(java.lang.StringBuffer value)
Writes on the native memory the specified java.lang.StringBuffer in the buffer address + the current relative position, each character is converted to one byte (C char), the '\0' character is written in the end.

Current implementation gets a String from the StringBuffer and writes to native memory with setAnsiString(String).

Parameters:
value - the new ANSI string to write.
See Also:
NativeBuffer.setAnsiStringBuffer(long,StringBuffer)

getUnicodeStringBuffer

java.lang.StringBuffer getUnicodeStringBuffer()
Returns a java.lang.StringBuffer read from the native memory in the buffer address + the current relative position until a '\0' character is found, converting each byte (C char) read to a Java char.

Current implementation reads a String with getUnicodeString() and copies it to a new StringBuffer.

Returns:
the ANSI StringBuffer read from native memory.
See Also:
NativeBuffer.getUnicodeStringBuffer(long)

setUnicodeStringBuffer

void setUnicodeStringBuffer(java.lang.StringBuffer value)
Writes on the native memory the specified java.lang.StringBuffer in the buffer address + the current relative position, each character is converted to two bytes (C wchar_t), the C L'\0' character is written in the end.

Current implementation gets a String from the StringBuffer and writes to native memory with setUnicodeString(String).

Parameters:
value - the new UNICODE string to write.
See Also:
NativeBuffer.setUnicodeStringBuffer(long,StringBuffer)

nextBooleanArray

boolean[] nextBooleanArray(boolean[] buff,
                           int index,
                           int length)
Returns a boolean array read from the native memory in the buffer address + the current relative position.

The iterator is moved forward length bytes (Java boolean size is 1 byte).

Parameters:
buff - the array to copy read data. Can not be null.
index - the starting index of buf to copy.
length - the number of elements to be copied.
Returns:
the data array read from native memory, the buf parameter.
See Also:
NativeBuffer.getBooleanArray(long,boolean[],int,int)

setBooleanArray

void setBooleanArray(boolean[] value,
                     int index,
                     int length)
Updates with a boolean data array the native memory in the buffer address + the current relative position.

The iterator is moved forward length bytes (Java boolean size is 1 byte).

Parameters:
value - the source array to write data in native memory. Can not be null.
index - the starting index of value to write.
length - the number of elements to be written.
See Also:
NativeBuffer.setBooleanArray(long,boolean[],int,int)

byte[] nextByteArray(byte[] buff,
                     int index,
                     int length)
Returns a byte array read from the native memory in the buffer address + the current relative position.

The iterator is moved forward length bytes (Java byte size is 1).

Parameters:
buff - the array to copy read data. Can not be null.
index - the starting index of buf to copy.
length - the number of elements to be copied.
Returns:
the data array read from native memory, the buf parameter.

nextCharArray

char[] nextCharArray(char[] buff,
                     int index,
                     int length)
Returns a char array read from the native memory in the buffer address + the current relative position.

The iterator is moved forward length * 2 bytes (Java char size is 2 bytes).

Parameters:
buff - the array to copy read data. Can not be null.
index - the starting index of buf to copy.
length - the number of elements to be copied.
Returns:
the data array read from native memory, the buf parameter.
See Also:
NativeBuffer.getCharArray(long,char[],int,int)

nextBuffer

NativeBuffer nextBuffer(long size)
Returns a new native buffer mapping a native memory part of the buffer.

The returned buffer is ever attached to the native memory (does not own the memory) and is independent of parent buffer (native memory shared is the only one dependency).

The iterator is moved forward size bytes.

Parameters:
size - the size of the native memory.
Returns:
a new buffer mapping a memory part.
See Also:
NativeBuffer.getBuffer(long,long)

setBuffer

void setBuffer(NativeBuffer value)
Copies the native memory data mapped by the specified buffer to this buffer starting in the buffer address + the current relative position.

The iterator is moved forward the size of the buffer argument.

Parameters:
value - the native buffer to be copied.
See Also:
NativeBuffer.setBuffer(long,NativeBuffer)
